title: How to make myself dream of something in particular - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello, yes there are ways to preprogram your brain to dream! One of the most common ways to do this is through lucid dreaming techniques, although this is not the only way. One of my personal favorite methods of dream incubation involves meditating upon and visualizing a specific scenario right before you fall asleep and then allowing your mind to drift off into that scenario thus creating a dream of it. Another method to try involves asking your subconscious to dream of a specific thing and then using affirmations such as ‘I am dreaming of XYZ’ immediately before falling asleep. Whether or not you remember the dream is debatable, but I have had personal success with these techniques! Good luck to you.

dreaming 101. self fulfilling request. just before you go to sleep like people praying laying down make a statement like I am going to learn something about myself in my dreams. I am going to dream something fantastic and out of this world or whatever and sleep on. you can find the meaning to most dreams by asking yourself how did that part make me feel from end to middle and beginning to middle. record on a voice app on your phone before you take a morning piss or you may forget everything no matter how real it seemed.

Before you sleep, ask your subsconscious self, to have a dream about this particular person. For example, if you're in love with someone, that's very easy. Your subconscious will oblige to show in your dreams all the scenarios that you will think will materialize in your waking state. Don't be fooled about them, your subsconscious self is deceiving and will play with your emotions. The best approach is go to the person and show your I interest.

Before sleeping you can try “saturating” your mind with the thing you want to influence the crafting of your dream. Using a candle to focus or a vocalising a mantra are some ways. I often find that an activity embracing a high emotional experience can influence the dream you have; a favourite TV/movie or song before bed can act as the seed.

Yes, you can, it is called “dream incubation” - when you program yourself before falling asleep. You can also learn “lucid dreaming” - but it is more difficult and require a lot of practice. In lucid dreaming, you need to “wake up” in a dream and realize that you are dreaming, and you can control the dream. You can google both terms, lots of info online.

If you will worry about a decision, and are serious about seeking your Higher Self’s answer to your question; and worry about this several times over the period of a week or so, you may attract the attention of your Higher Self. It may or may not give you a dream about your concern. Some people like to employ “lucid dreaming” techniques to achieve a given result. I do not use this technique. Sorry.

You can consume lots of media, do something related to, or think a lot about this thing or topic. As you go to sleep, thing about that thing. That should make you a lot more likely to see this thing in your dreams.

It is possible, with some people they have no issue with creating dreams like this. Usually it is based on self programming the thought so that it constantly plays out in your mind. For me personally I find it not as enticing as letting the dream play out randomly, I find the surprise of such dreams more informative.

Lucid dreaming. Read about it. Takes a while to learn (there are exercises which will help) but once you experience being in direct contact with your subconscious you will understand how powerful this is. I used it to remove a spider phobia. Now I like spiders. Good Luck
Focus on the subject intently ( when possible)thru out the day. Go to sleep with it on your mind. Continue until the dream happens. With some luck, it may even be a lucid dream.
Try thinking about the topic you want to dream about right before you go to bed.
